flawed_nl_solution:
The season is broken up into 22/2=<<22/2=11>>11 episode based on cost
The first 11 episodes cost 11*1000=${<<11*1000=11000>>}11000
The next set of episodes cost 1000*1.2=${<<1000*1.2=12000>>}12000 more per episode
So they cost 1000+12000=${<<1000+12000=13000>>}13000 each
So in total they cost 13000*11=${<<13000*11=143000>>}143000
So in total the season cost 143000+11000=${<<143000+11000=154000>>}154000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200.0, not 12000.0. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
